node.text: This is terrible! The most horrible miscarriage of justice! Poor Arren...

option.optiontext: Arren? I need to 'talk' to him.

node.text: That won't be possible now. They took him away to the dungeons of Castle Murk! Nobody's allowed to see the prisoners down there...

option.optiontext: Why, what has he done?
Castle Murk..? I recall it used to be called the Mistcastle in times past.
Can I check inside Arren's house?
There's no way into the dungeons?

node.text: The Mistcastle...? I remember an old man called it that when I was a little girl. But everyone really calls it Castle Murk, which is fitting if you ask me, for the oppressive tyrant residing within it.

option.optiontext: Why did they imprison Arren?
Can I check inside Arren's house?
There's no way into the dungeons?
I see, thank you.

node.text: Well, yes I suppose... The door should be open, but mind his herbal cabinet. Arren once told me some of his herbs can even cause death if mishandled.

option.optiontext: Why did they imprison Arren?
So, Castle Murk..? I recall it used to be called the Mistcastle in times past.
There's no way into the dungeons?
I see, thank you.

node.text: That's just not happened in ages. No matter how much townsfolk have pleaded with the guards, they never let anyone in. Far too often people get thrown in and they just disappear, never to be heard from again...
It's monstrous! Though, awhile back there were rumors that somebody managed to escape, somehow through underground tunnels, but I don't really know anything more about that.

option.optiontext: A way out might also mean a way in... who'd know more?
Why would they imprison Arren?
So, Castle Murk..? I recall it used to be called the Mistcastle in times past.
Can I check inside Arren's house?
I see, thank you.

node.text: Umm... I'm not really sure. Those aren't really the kind of secrets good folk like I would know. But if you're very determined, maybe you could ask some of the more seedy characters around Thornhill. Sadly, they're not hard to find these days.

option.optiontext: Why would they imprison Arren?
So, Castle Murk..? I recall it used to be called the Mistcastle in times past.
Can I check inside Arren's house?
I see, thank you.

node.text: He hasn't done anything wrong! He's been healing the city's poor, especially since the Blistering Plague swept through our city. But he made our traditional 'village healer' Marlene look bad, so now she's trying to get rid of him! She's a terrible healer too; tells people to smear cow dung on their faces for their every ill!

option.optiontext: So, Castle Murk..? I recall it used to be called the Mistcastle in times past.
Can I check inside Arren's house?
There's no way into the dungeons?
I see, thank you.

node.text: Poor Arren... He really is a good man, broke my daughter's fever when she had the plague. I just hope they don't hurt him.

option.optiontext: Do they not allow seeing the prisoners?
Where did you say they were holding him?
Why would they imprison Arren?
Can I check inside Arren's house?

node.text: They took him away to the dungeons of Castle Murk! Nobody's allowed to see the prisoners down there...

option.optiontext: There's no way to reach him?
Why would they imprison Arren?
Can I check inside Arren's house?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: He hasn't done anything wrong! He's been healing the city's poor, especially since the Blistering Plight swept through our city. But he made our traditional 'village healer' Marlene look bad, so now she's trying to get rid of him! She's a terrible healer too; tells people to smear cow dung on their faces for their every ill!

option.optiontext: Where did you say they were holding him?
Can I check inside Arren's house?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Well, yes I suppose... The door should be open, but mind his herbal cabinet. Arren once told me some of his herbs can even cause death if mishandled.

option.optiontext: Where did you say they were holding him?
Why would they imprison Arren?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: That's just not happened in ages. No matter how much townsfolk have pleaded with the guards, they never let anyone in. Far too often people get thrown in and they just disappear, never to be heard from again...
It's monstrous! Though, awhile back there were rumors that somebody managed to escape, somehow through underground tunnels, but I don't really know anything more about that.

option.optiontext: A way out might also mean a way in... who'd know more?
Why would they imprison Arren?
Can I check inside Arren's house?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Umm... I'm not really sure. Those aren't really the kind of secrets good folk like I would know. But if you're very determined, maybe you could ask some of the more seedy characters around Thornhill. Sadly, they're not hard to find these days.

option.optiontext: Why would they imprison Arren?
Can I check inside Arren's house?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: The Lord Mayor and his men want a scapegoat for the plague that recently swept the streets - the Blistering Plight - to draw attention away from their own incompetency I think. Who better than the fearsome ''Witch of the Silvermirror Fen''.

Obviously they can't get the witch, so the witch's servant must do. Perhaps you noticed the so-called-healer, Marlene, my accuser? I'm the one who actually tried to help people during the plague, to heal them, but... alas that made Marlene look bad.

option.optiontext: People really fear this Witch?
Are you really a druid?
Any ideas how to open your cell?
Let's get you out of there - I've found the keys.
Wait here, I'll try to find a way to release you.

node.text: A dark reputation rightly lingers around the Witch. I would know, I myself spent a moment in her captivity, only... The Witch was vanquished by someone. Someone who became the new Witch, someone who's different, righteous...

option.optiontext: You're speaking of Eloria?
Are you really a druid?
Any ideas how to open your cell?
Let's get you out of there - I've found the keys.
Wait here, I'll try to find a way to release you.

node.text: Yes, she... made quite the impression on me.

option.optiontext: Are you really a druid?
Any ideas how to open your cell?
Let's get you out of there - I've found the keys.
Wait here, I'll try to find a way to release you.

node.text: Wondering what one of my kind is doing in a big city? Sadly, I've not been in touch with my Ebongreen brothers and sisters in some time now. Yet my talents were needed here, especially with the onset of the Blistering Plight.

option.optiontext: Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Any ideas how to open your cell?
Let's get you out of there - I've found the keys.
Wait here, I'll try to find a way to release you.

node.text: Wait, you don't look like one of the guards... who are you?

option.optiontext: A concerned citizen, here to get you out.
The lady in the swamp is our mutual friend - I need you to contact her.

node.text: Oh, truly? Then I shan't turn down your offer. I'm glad there are still those in this city who do not sit idly by in the face of injustice.

option.optiontext: Any ideas how to open your cell?
I have the keys, let's get you out of there.
Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Are you really a druid?
Wait here, I'll try to find a way to release you.

node.text: I've been watching the guards on this level. Every time they open and lock the cells, they return to the end of this hallway. I think that's where they have their break room, and where they keep the keys.

option.optiontext: Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Are you really a druid?
Wait here, I'll see if I can retrieve them.

node.text: You know of her - you know Eloria? But... I don't remember she ever mentioned anyone like you. Who are you?

option.optiontext: Someone whose connection goes far back...

node.text: I see... so you heard the accusations? That I contact her through a magical mirror. It's true, but the Lord-Mayor's men confiscated the mirror when they arrested me. For all I know, it's securely guarded now.

option.optiontext: Let's get you out first; any ideas how to open your cell?
Let's get you out of there first - I've found the keys.
Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Are you really a druid?
Wait here, I'll try to find a way to release you.

node.text: Sure, I don't think I'm going anywhere.
You're back, friend! Have you found a way to free me?

option.optiontext: Any ideas how to open your cell?
I've found the keys, let's get you out of there.
Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Are you really a druid?
Wait, I'm still looking for a way.

node.text: We'll still need to get my magical mirror, it's important not to leave it behind. I believe they hold confiscated items under guard in the warden's office below.

option.optiontext: Know anything about the warden?
Are you able to fight?
Let's go.

node.text: Only in the way of rumors, that Warden Garrick Ravidrasse is one of the Lord Mayor's most trusted and most ruthless men, quick to resort to violence.

option.optiontext: Are you able to fight?
Let's go.

node.text: I'm quite capable in curing diseases, but much less so as a fighter I'm afraid. I was hoping I can count on you, friend.

option.optiontext: Know anything about the warden?
Let's go.

node.text: Please, friend... it's important we get my magical mirror back from the warden downstairs.

option.optiontext: Know anything about the warden?
Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Are you really a druid?
Don't worry.

node.text: Only in the way of rumors, that Warden Garrick Ravidrasse is one of the Lord Mayor's most trusted and most ruthless men, quick to resort to violence.

option.optiontext: Why were they so eager to arrest you?
Are you really a druid?
I see.

node.text: The Lord Mayor and his men want a scapegoat for the plague that recently swept the streets - the Blistering Plight - to draw attention away from their own incompetency I think. Who better than the fearsome ''Witch of the Silvermirror Fen''.

Obviously they can't get the witch, so the witch's servant must do. Perhaps you noticed the so-called-healer, Marlene, my accuser? I'm the one who actually tried to help people during the plague, to heal them, but... alas that made Marlene look bad.

option.optiontext: People really fear this Witch?
Know anything about the warden?
Are you really a druid?
I see.

node.text: A dark reputation rightly lingers around the Witch. I would know, I myself spent a moment in her captivity, only... The Witch was vanquished by someone. Someone who became the new Witch, someone who's different, righteous...

option.optiontext: You're speaking of Eloria?
Know anything about the warden?
Are you really a druid?
I see.

node.text: Yes, she... made quite the impression on me.

option.optiontext: Know anything about the warden?
Are you really a druid?
I see.

node.text: Wondering what one of my kind is doing in a big city? Sadly, I've not been in touch with my Ebongreen brothers and sisters in some time now. Yet my talents were needed here, especially with the onset of the Blistering Plight.

option.optiontext: Know anything about the warden?
Why were they so eager to arrest you?
I see.

node.text: No point in delaying. We should make ourselves scarce before more guards arrive.

option.optiontext: Remind me, what's so important about this mirror?
Remind me, what's so important about this mirror?
Wait, I'm not done looting.
You're right.

node.text: But would you place us at further risk? It saddens me that material gains mean so much to you...

option.optiontext: Shush now, Mr. Druid.

node.text: You said you were looking to contact Eloria? Well this mirror offers a way to do it. It will connect to its counterpart at the swamp, where Eloria resides. I must urgently speak with her as well.

option.optiontext: Wait here, I'm not done looting.
We should get going then.

node.text: It will connect with the lady in the swamp. Don't worry friend, she's nothing evil like people here believe. I must speak with her urgently, she must be worried sick after not hearing from me.

option.optiontext: Wait here, I'm not done looting.
We should get going then.

node.text: It will sadden me to leave behind my home in the city, but I fear I'm no longer welcome here. Thank you, friend, for getting me out of there. I'm not sure how I'll ever repay you.

option.optiontext: Nevermind that, what do you plan to do now?

node.text: It will sadden me to leave behind my home in the city, but I fear I'm no longer welcome here. Thank you for getting me out of there. Arranging a meeting with Eloria is the least I can do for you.

option.optiontext: Let's not waste any time on that; you said we reach her through the mirror?
Mind if we talk first?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?

node.text: Great tea, don't you think?

option.optiontext: Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.
There's something I wanted to ask.

node.text: I must contact the lady in the swamp - Eloria - and let her know I am well. Yes, she is now the 'Silvermirror Witch' but I hate calling her that. She's a benevolent woman who saved my life.

option.optiontext: Let's not waste time, I am eager to meet her as well.
Mind if we talk first?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?

node.text: Indeed, we should take a breath and talk. Well done handling Warden Ravidrasse, by the way. He was a man with a fearsome reputation.

option.optiontext: So, you have a mirror that connects to the 'Silvermirror Witch'?
Are you really a druid?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?
Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.

node.text: Indeed, there is but a simple chant I must recite to make her appear.

option.optiontext: Let's do it.
Wait, there's something I wanted to ask.
How about we have some tea first, to calm the nerves...?

node.text: Great tea, don't you thi...*cough, cough, cough!* ...ahem...! ...how strange...\n\n<color=#9C8C77> *The poison burns ever so slightly in your throat. Out of the two of you, however, you're the one who literally cannot die.* </color>

option.optiontext: Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.
There's something I wanted to ask.

node.text: That is an excellent idea! My special blend of herbal tea is exactly what situations like these call for.

I see what you're thinking. Mine is not *the* infamous Silver Mirror, though it's certainly an object of magic created by the Silvermirror Witches. The original was made for possessing minds, according to legends anyway.

option.optiontext: Then how does your mirror work?
Are you really a druid?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?
Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.

node.text: A simple means for communication. The mirror has a sibling at the swamp, with my lady Eloria. When properly activated, it allows us to see each other through its glass, even across vast distances.

option.optiontext: To be fair, that 'Wise Woman' wasn't too far off in her accusations.
Are you really a druid?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?
Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.

node.text: Ah yes, Marlene... The Silvermirror Witch has always been greatly feared and despised in Thornhill, and understandably so. But the reason Marlene would even begin to accuse me of acting in service of evil, it lies elsewhere entirely I'm afraid.
You see, Marlene isn't really very adept at healing at all. But I am, and this has made her look bad. She must have been lurking behind my windows, must have seen me me speaking with Eloria...

option.optiontext: You weren't busy spreading a plague among the townsfolk then?
You're really a druid?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?
Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.

node.text: Goodness, of course not! I was trying to heal them. The plague was most likely brought by traders from faraway lands, I do not believe there was anything sinister behind it. Such plagues are known to happen, simply an unfortunate tragedy.

option.optiontext: You're really a druid?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?
Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.

node.text: Wondering what one of my kind is doing in a big city? Sadly, I've not been in touch with my Ebongreen brothers and sisters in some time now. Yet my talents were needed here, especially with the onset of the Blistering Plight.

option.optiontext: And you have a mirror that connects to the 'Silvermirror Witch'?
How about we have some tea, to calm the nerves...?
Let's not waste more time, I'm eager to meet Eloria.

node.text: You find Arren's cabinet full of various medicinal herbs and substances, alongside a mortar and pestle. Medicine, or maybe even a deadly poison could be created with the right know-how. Perhaps there is an instructive book nearby.

option.optiontext: Attempt to brew a mixture.

node.text: Select your first ingredient.

option.optiontext: Violet Alder's Pollen
Moonshade Leaf
Dragon's Marrow
Barblethorn Berries

node.text: Second ingredient.

option.optiontext: Dragon's marrow
Moonshade leaf

node.text: Third ingredient.

option.optiontext: Licorice root
Dried bellspore
Everspring bramble

node.text: Final ingredient.

option.optiontext: Snowdrop flower
Thule pepper
Juniper seeds

node.text: You have no idea what this mess you've created is, so you throw it away.

option.optiontext: Let's start over.

node.text: Second ingredient.

option.optiontext: Dragon's Marrow
Dreamy Yarrow

node.text: Second ingredient.

option.optiontext: Moonshade Leaf

node.text: Third ingredient.

option.optiontext: Blackslime root.
Dried bellspore
Licorice root

node.text: Third ingredient.

option.optiontext: Dried bellspore
Bloodvine ivy
Everspring bramble

node.text: Final ingredient.

option.optiontext: More blackslime root!
Snowdrop flower
Thule pepper

node.text: Final ingredient.

option.optiontext: Snowdrop flower
Thule pepper

node.text: You managed to create plenty of Tipsy Owl agent!

option.optiontext: I want to craft something else.
Perfect! Now, where to put this...

node.text: You managed to create plenty of Rosethorn agent!

option.optiontext: I want to craft something else.
Perfect! Now, where to put this...

node.text: The table is littered with some sort of tea leaves and a pot that has a note saying 'especially good for nerves'. The pot appears to be full of ground tea.

option.optiontext: Spike the tea with an abundance of Tipsy Owl agent.
Spike the tea with an abundance of Rosethorn agent.
Leave it be.

node.text: Now if only you could get Arren to drink this...
State your purpose in Thornhill, traveler! The Lord Mayor doesn't take kindly to vagrants wandering his streets.

option.optiontext: Looking for a healer, goes by the name Arren.
Erm... trade, I'm here to trade.
None of your business.

node.text: Why, you ain't sick are you? You look a bit too pale for my liking. Maybe I should gut you where you stand for trying to bring disease into our city, Thornhill only just survived one plague.

option.optiontext: I see we got off on the wrong foot, how about I pay you coin for the ''toll''? <color=orange>(50 coins)</color>
Not here for healing, I have other business to settle.
Sure you want to do that? Whatever I have, might get yourself infected.

node.text: Hold on, hold on, hold on... Am I to understand that you're trying to offer us - the good honest soldiers of Thornhill - a bribe?

option.optiontext: That's exactly what I'm offering.
Erm... ''toll?''

node.text: Bwahahaha, I like the balls on you! You have us pecked right, what matters most here is what you have in your purse - welcome to Thornhill, traveler. Let the man through!

option.optiontext: Wait, where do I find the healer - Arren?

node.text: Bwahahaha! Just messing with you, we'll take your coin gladly. Only thing that matters 'round here is what you got in your purse - welcome to Thornhill, traveler. Let the man through!

option.optiontext: Wait, where do I find the healer - Arren?

node.text: Is that so? And what other business might you have with a healer?

option.optiontext: Umm... delivering supplies, of course.
That's not your problem.

node.text: I'll need to inspect that.

option.optiontext: I'm carrying simple healing herbs.
I carry simple healing potions.
How about I pay you coin for the ''toll'' instead'? <color=orange>(50 coins)</color>
It really is none of your business.

node.text: I'll need to inspect that.

option.optiontext: See - dandelions?
See - redberries?
Actually, I carry healing potions.
How about I pay you coin for the ''toll'' instead'? <color=orange>(50 coins)</color>
It really is none of your business.

node.text: I'll need to inspect that.

option.optiontext: See - a mild healing potion?
See - a healing potion?
See - a robust healing potion?
Actually, I carry healing herbs.
How about I pay you coin for the ''toll'' instead'? <color=orange>(50 coins)</color>
It really is none of your business.

node.text: Ah well, what do I know about healing anyway? Let the man through!

option.optiontext: Wait, where do I find the healer - Arren?

node.text: Eh? I look like a tour guide to you? Ah well, if it gets you out of my hair...
Take me for a fool, eh? Then where's your caravan, where's your goods? Liar... give me one good reason I shouldn't gut you where you stand!

option.optiontext: I see we got off on the wrong foot, how about I pay you coin for the ''toll''? <color=orange>(50 coins)</color>
I'd certainly like to see you try.

node.text: Yeah, it kind of is. Either you explain yourself, or I won't let you enter the city.

option.optiontext: I'd like to see you try and stop me.
Looking for a healer, goes by the name Arren.
Erm... Trade, I'm here to trade.

node.text: Eh? Sounds like you got something to hide. Give me one good reason I shouldn't gut you where you stand!

option.optiontext: I see we got off on the wrong foot, how about I pay you coin for the ''toll''? <color=orange>(50 coins)</color>
I'd certainly like to see you try.

node.text: Alright then! Men, let's welcome this worm to Thornhill!
Diseased freak... Just stay the hell away from me.
Northeastern side of the city, Mudderside. You'll have to cross the bridge by the marketplace to get there. The location for beggars smugglers and healers apparently. Now get going.
I might... who're you lookin' to break out?

option.optiontext: What's it to you?

node.text: Usually folks who're lookin' to escape the dungeons are also lookin' to escape the city. I can help with that... for a price of course.

option.optiontext: Just need to know about the passage.
Forget I asked.

node.text: Just knowledge, eh? Ain't so sure I'm willin' to divulge such sensitive informations to folks outside of my customs, you understand?
Rharharharharhar! Listen to you go, usin' such fancy language all learned like.
You shut your mouth!

option.optiontext: How about I enter your 'customs' then? <color=orange>(80 coins)</color>
Forget I asked.

node.text: That'll do. Ain't long ago I shipped a guy out of the city, had been locked up for gettin' a bit too political with the Lord-Mayor. Apparently his wife arranged his exit through the cemetery. You see...
Ain't long ago I shipped a guy out of the city, had been locked up for gettin' bit too political with them Lord-Mayor. Apparently his wife arranged the exit through the cemetery. You see...

There's a network of old catacombs runnin' beneath the city, opening up at the cemetery. And as it happens, it ain't a stretch to use those catacombs to break in and out of the castle's underground prison.

option.optiontext: But if there's already been an escape, wouldn't they have sealed the route?
That's all I need, thanks.

node.text: Hah! Heard the guards tried to get the best stonemason in the city to do that for them, but the bugger had the nerve to demand payment for his services. The guards didn't like that, so they locked him up.
Flamin' idiots... Still, I heard they boarded up the opening, but that ain't a problem exactly... If your're determined, you can probably break it down with somethin' heavy, like a massive hammer.

option.optiontext: Interesting, I see...

node.text: And you come to me with this question, why? I'm an honest business man. What makes you think I'd know anything about such topics?

option.optiontext: Well, do you?

node.text: Of course I do, but that's beside the point! Ah, whatever... I will tell you what you want to know, but it shall cost you 100 gold coins. Nothing in my shop comes for free.

option.optiontext: Fine, then speak. <color=orange>(100 coins)</color>
Phaw, forget I asked.

node.text: Indeed, this passage you so carelessly mention is a broken wall that connects the dungeons with the old catacombs running beneath the city. The catacombs on the other hand can be accessed from the cemetery.

Oh and you may also want to know there already was an escape not too long ago, which prompted the guards to attempt to seal the way. However, as always, they did a lousy job of it, boarding it up. I'd estimate a hefty warhammer is enough to break it down.

option.optiontext: I see...

node.text: An' ye thought this might be the right place to ask? Well yer right - it is - but thing is folk 'ere ain't very talkative, 'specially to other folk they don't know.

option.optiontext: How about you, could you be talkative?
Hm, maybe there's an easy way to make friends...
Nevermind, forget I asked.

node.text: Nah, I don't know nothin'. I ain't some underworld mastermind, y'know? Just tryin' to make an honest livin' sellin' beer. Tell ya what though, that fellow next door sellin' jewelry? He's definitely connected. Take care though, he also has a price - always.

option.optiontext: Hm, maybe there's an easy way to make friends here...
Alright, thanks for the info.
Let me see what you're serving.
How about you, could you be talkative?

node.text: Oh yeah mate. There's a broken bit of wall between the prison and the underground catacombs. Use it all the time to pass messages to prisoners. All you gotta do is slip in through the cemetery.

Thing is, anyone trying to escape has still gotta get through all the guards, so that part ain't as easy. That one lad who managed it, only did it cause he was some political guy with influence, so he had one of the guards helping him.

option.optiontext: I see... cheers.

node.text: Look, I run a clean inn here, and I don't get involved in any shady business. I can't say I know anything about the dungeons, but if you're looking for some questionable information, you might want to try chatting up those sailors behind the building in the harbor. They seem to be privy to things that go beyond my knowledge.

option.optiontext: I see, thanks.
